intro: Herschelia hamatopetala, commonly known as the hairy petal lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Lecanoraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive thallus structure, which is typically crustose and forms a firm, adherent layer on rock surfaces. The plant exhibits a pale to dark yellowish-orange color, with a finely granular texture that helps in its identification. It is often found in temperate regions, growing on calcareous substrates in shaded environments. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and localized species.
